question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What office did Ernesto Amorín Larrañaga hold before 1995?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unwavering Statesman: Ernesto Amorín Larrañaga's Rise to Prominence

In the small yet vibrant nation of Uruguay, a stalwart figure emerged in the mid-20th century, leaving an indelible mark on the country's political landscape. Ernesto Amorín Larrañaga, a man of unwavering dedication and unshakeable conviction, rose through the ranks of Uruguay's political hierarchy to assume the esteemed position of President of the Chamber of Representatives of Uruguay. Born in 1920, Larrañaga's early life was marked by a strong sense of justice and a desire to serve his community. He pursued a career in law, earning his degree from the University of the Republic in Montevideo. As a young lawyer, Larrañaga quickly gained recognition for his exceptional oratory skills and his ability to navigate the complexities of Uruguay's legal system. Larrañaga's entry into politics was a natural progression, driven by his passion for public service and his commitment to improving the lives of Uruguayans. He began his political career as a member of the Colorado Party, one of the country's two dominant political forces. His tireless work ethic, coupled with his ability to build consensus and forge alliances, soon earned him a reputation as a skilled and effective politician. In the 1960s, Larrañaga's star continued to rise as he assumed various leadership roles within the Colorado Party. His dedication to the party's ideals and his ability to articulate a compelling vision for Uruguay's future resonated with voters and party leaders alike. It was during this period that Larrañaga first caught the attention of the nation's political elite, who recognized his potential to occupy the highest echelons of power. The turning point in Larrañaga's career came in 1971, when he was elected to the Chamber of Representatives of Uruguay. This milestone marked the beginning of a new chapter in his political journey, as he quickly established himself as a respected and influential voice within the chamber. His mastery of parliamentary procedure, combined with his ability to build bridges across party lines, earned him the admiration of his peers and the respect of his opponents. The crowning achievement of Larrañaga's political career came when he was elected President of the Chamber of Representatives of Uruguay.
content.source_2: In the year 2033, the world was on the cusp of a new era of global cooperation and technological advancement. As the clock struck midnight on January 8th, Ernesto Amorín Larrañaga, a seasoned Uruguayan lawyer and politician, stood poised to take on the most significant challenge of his career. At the age of 113, he was about to become the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs of the Dutch government, a position that would test his mettle like never before. As Larrañaga settled into his new role, he was acutely aware of the weight of history on his shoulders. Born in 1920, he had lived through some of the most tumultuous decades of the 20th century, and had witnessed firsthand the rise and fall of empires, the birth of new nations, and the evolution of global politics. Now, as he embarked on this new chapter, he was determined to bring his wealth of experience to bear on the complex issues facing the world. The first few weeks of Larrañaga's tenure were a whirlwind of activity, as he met with world leaders, diplomats, and policymakers to get a sense of the lay of the land. He was struck by the sheer pace of change in the world, and the ways in which technology was transforming the way nations interacted with one another. From the ubiquitous presence of artificial intelligence to the rapid expansion of renewable energy, Larrañaga was fascinated by the possibilities and challenges that these developments presented. As the months passed, Larrañaga proved himself to be a shrewd and effective diplomat, able to navigate the treacherous waters of international politics with ease. He played a key role in brokering a historic peace agreement between two long-warring nations, and worked tirelessly to promote greater cooperation on issues such as climate change and global health. But despite his many successes, Larrañaga knew that his time in office was limited. He had always been mindful of his own mortality, and as he approached his 114th birthday, he began to feel the weight of his years. On March 17th, 2034, after a remarkable 14 months in office, Larrañaga tendered his resignation as Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, leaving behind a legacy that would be remembered for generations to come.

answer: Member of the Chamber of Representatives of Uruguay
